intro: Mouriri gonavensis var. hottensis, commonly known as the Hottentot Mouriri, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
